metadata.synopsis: Vlaakith offers a last chance for Laezel to do her bidding and kill Orpheus, promising ascension. Avatar Laezel can speak up against it or agree, but not sure if it's going to have any long term impact.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Camp night becomes available as soon as the player enters Act3.Debug:- queue NIGHT_Laezel_VlaakithVisit- Make sure you have Laezel as Avatar- Long rest in WYR_Main_A or CTY_Main_A

80.context: CinematicNodeContext: The party enters camp. A moment later, a column of silvery light descends from above. It transforms into a hologram of Vlaakith exactly as seen in the creche moments.

21.speaker: Vlaakith
21.text: Raise your eyes. Look upon She Who Conquers.

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *The projection exudes immense psionic energy. Only five thousand senja'si and five thousand gish, gathered in Tu'narath, could convey such an image.*

32.speaker: Vlaakith
32.text: I named you Hshar'lak. Yet you still call me Queen.

46.speaker: Vlaakith
46.text: Yes, I see it. A flicker of faith. You yearn for purity and mercy. You yearn for a place in Tu'narath still.

6.speaker: Vlaakith
6.text: You are Hshar'lak. And still you speak my name.

11.speaker: Vlaakith
11.text: Insolent. Ignorant. But I know a flicker of faith still burns inside you.

30.speaker: Vlaakith
30.text: You yearn for purity and mercy. You yearn for a place in Tu'narath still.

78.speaker: Vlaakith
78.text: You may yet have it. For I am not wholly without pity.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: Tell me. What must I do to regain your trust?

44.speaker: Vlaakith
44.text: Your word. Your faith. Your eternal promise in exchange for mine.

1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers. Its power is waning.

13.speaker: Vlaakith
13.text: I have only a moment. And you, Hshar'lak, will listen.

22.speaker: Vlaakith
22.text: Mother Gith made us a city. I made us an empire. We move mountains, we snuff out stars, we shake the planes.

25.speaker: Vlaakith
25.text: The traitor Voss has lied to you. The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *Can this be true? Is Prince Orpheus really such a threat to your people or simply a challenge to Vlaakith's rule?*

65.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hologram flickers once more.

57.speaker: Vlaakith
57.text: Find a way into the Prism. Slay Orpheus. All will be made right.

76.speaker: Vlaakith
76.text: I will cleanse your infection. I will ascend you. You will be no mere warrior, nor kith'rak. You will be Baht t'Vlaakith.

24.speaker: Vlaakith
24.text: Commander of Dragons. My only. My Chosen.

47.speaker: Vlaakith
47.text: A final chance. Kneel before me. Make your promise.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: Use the tadpole. Seek Vlaakith's mind through her psionic conveyance.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Water and blood. They envelop you, they drag you downward. You are submerged in past, present, and future.*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *The zaith'isk device doesn't cleanse the parasite - it's used for extracting memories and killing the infected.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *Vlaakith does not welcome her finest young warriors into her royal city to reward them, but to consume their essence in her quest for godhood.*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *The lich queen doesn't intend to reward you, but to devour you. She speaks only in lies.*

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *In this endless sea of understanding, you find truth. There is no cleansing, no ascension, no Chosen. You are Vlaakith's pawn, and nothing more.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Your mind spins, your heart races. There is only endless void, an ocean of grey and violet.*

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: Kneel before Vlaakith. Promise to slay Orpheus.

62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Lae'zel kneels before Vlaakith.

29.speaker: Vlaakith
29.text: One promise. One drop in the Astral Sea.

68.speaker: Vlaakith
68.text: Do not fail me. For you would not survive the flood to follow.

33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel rises and the hologram flickers away

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: No. I will not kill Orpheus for you.

72.speaker: Vlaakith
72.text: The kith'raki will bring you. I will tear your flesh from your bones and devour your skull's marrow while you beg for death.

17.speaker: Vlaakith
17.text: I will consume you. I will unmake you!
17.context: NodeContext: As deranged as possible without having an aneurysm.

48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vlaakith's hologram flickers, then fades away.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: I have seen the truth. I reject you, Queen of Lies - I will not be your puppet.

41.speaker: Vlaakith
41.text: I am Vlaakith. Undying Queen of the noble githyanki. God Regent of the Six Arms of Tu'narath.

71.speaker: Vlaakith
71.text: The Heretic Prince would shatter us in an instant. The Great Dominion, shrunk to the head of a pin.

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *Can the Heretic Prince really be such a threat to your queen's rule? He is a prisoner, shackled, impotent.*

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: Get to the point. Why are you here?

53.speaker: Vlaakith
53.text: I am sovereign of the Astral Plane, Queen Regent of the City of Death. You could ask any question, yet you choose only the obvious.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: I don't want your pity. I don't want your mercy. I want you gone from this place.

66.speaker: Vlaakith
66.text: I am the Eternal Empress, she who presides over the One in the Void. I do not require an invitation.

73.speaker: Vlaakith
73.text: Tsk'va. I should have expected no better from Hshar'lak.

50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Extra cine node to allow more time for the previous cinematics to play.

5.speaker: Vlaakith
5.text: Vlaakith tavki na'zin. I am truth.

27.speaker: Vlaakith
27.text: And you - you are an abomination twice over. You carry a ghaik parasite. And you harbour the Heretic Prince Orpheus.

81.speaker: Vlaakith
81.text: I have only a moment. And you, vin'iisk, will listen.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Your queen has bridged the planes to meet with you. An act of great power, but what drives it - authority or fear?*

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *Prince Orpheus may be a threat to your people as she claims, or perhaps, a threat to her rule.*

8.speaker: Vlaakith
8.text: Find a way into the Astral Prism. Slay Orpheus the pretender.

43.speaker: Vlaakith
43.text: Kneel before me. Make your promise.

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *Your queen is terrible and mighty as you ever dreamed. It seems unfathomable that she could be afraid of an imprisoned, impotent prince.*

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: A projection this powerful? Impossible - isn't it?

26.speaker: Vlaakith
26.text: Five thousand senja'si, five thousand gish - gathered in Tu'narath. They convey my essence through a single psionic thread.
26.context: NodeContext: sen-JAH-see, gish. (Sorcerers) / TOO-nah-rahth (gith capital city)

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: Vlaakith? Get out of my camp. You're not welcome here.
